item.title: Cracked End on an Equalizer Bar Needs Replacement
item.description: See how a damaged equalizer bar is safely removed and rebuilt to restore proper function. What step do you think is the most critical in a job like this?

media:content.media:title: Cracked End on an Equalizer Bar Needs Replacement
media:content.media:description: See how a damaged equalizer bar is safely removed and rebuilt to restore proper function. What step do you think is the most critical in a job like this?

item.title: Crack Repair: Double-Acting Telescopic Cylinder
item.description: A detailed look at repairing a cracked telescopic cylinder through careful machining and skilled technique. What part of the repair process interests you most?

item.title: Machining This Shaft Didn’t Go According to Plan
item.description: A routine shaft job takes an unexpected turn, highlighting the value of technique and troubleshooting in the shop. How would you handle a mid-project surprise?

item.title: Trunnion Repair for Caterpillar's Largest Dozer
item.description: Follow the careful machining and repair process on a major dozer component, showing how precision brings heavy equipment back to life. What part should be repaired next?

item.title: Mother of All Cutters: Time to Test It
item.description: Watch a powerful new cutter put through its paces as it tackles a demanding machining test. How do you think it will perform on its next challenge?

item.title: Our New RapidBlast™ SD140 Dustless Blaster Is Here!
item.description: A look at the setup and first run of the new RapidBlast SD140. See how this dustless system supports cleaner, more efficient surface prep. How would you use it?

item.title: Custom Drive Coupling for the Franna Crane
item.description: The Franna crane project continues with machining a custom drive coupling built for strength and accuracy. How will this upgrade improve the crane’s performance?

item.title: Fitting the Nut on a Hydraulic Cylinder Rod
item.description: A step-by-step view of machining and fitting a hydraulic cylinder rod nut for a secure, accurate assembly. What part of this process is most critical?

item.title: Making a Giant Shop-Made Boring Bar
item.description: A detailed look at designing and machining an oversized boring bar built entirely in the shop for heavy-duty precision work. How would you use a tool like this?

item.title: Fixing Stripped and Damaged Bolt Holes
item.description: The team repairs worn bolt holes using precision machining and thread restoration to bring the part back to spec. What method works best for repairs like this?

item.title: Repairing a Cracked CAT 789 Suspension Piece
item.description: The team assesses and repairs a cracked suspension component from a CAT 789, using careful welding and machining steps. How well will the restored part perform?

item.title: Machining a Flywheel Plate for a CAT Engine
item.description: A detailed look at machining a precise flywheel drive plate for a high-power CAT engine, covering setup, alignment, and final cuts. What makes this part so critical?

item.title: Repairing Hydraulic Cylinder Barrels
item.description: A detailed look at straightening, machining, and rebuilding hydraulic cylinder barrels to restore proper function. What part of the repair process is most critical?

item.title: Fixing the Big Lathe After a Breakdown
item.description: After a major issue sidelines the large lathe, the crew walks through diagnosing the problem and carrying out the repair. Will the machine be running smoothly again soon?

item.title: Making a Rotary Ground Clamp
item.description: A step-by-step look at creating a custom rotary ground clamp in the shop, from design to fabrication and testing. How could this tool improve your welding setup?

item.title: Restoring the Boom on a Franna Crane
item.description: The team tackles wear and damage on a Franna crane boom, using careful machining and repair techniques to bring it back to strength. What challenges will the restoration reveal?

item.title: Kitchen Upgrade and Horizontal Borer Work
item.description: A combined look at improving a home kitchen while also tackling setup and machining on a Walker horizontal facing borer. How will both projects come together?

item.title: John Deere Grader Blade Issues Revealed
item.description: A blade change on a John Deere grader exposes more wear than expected, leading to a deeper inspection and repair plan. What will the team find next?

item.title: CAT 140M in Need of Attention
item.description: The crew inspects a CAT 140M and uncovers several issues that require careful mechanical work. From diagnostics to repairs, every step aims to restore smooth operation. Will the fixes be enough?

item.title: Line Boring and Bore Welding in Action
item.description: A detailed look at how line boring and bore welding restore worn components with precision. The team walks through setup, alignment, and final machining to bring parts back to spec. Could this method solve more repairs than expected?
